Question: What is the name of your data center network modernization project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this network infrastructure initiative?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority (typically VP Infrastructure or Network Director)
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What challenges are driving the need for data center network modernization?
Guidance: Common challenges: Aging Cisco infrastructure, High support costs, Cloud-native workload support, Network automation, East-west traffic growth, Multi-tenancy
Notes: Primary business driver for network refresh

Question: What is your current data center network infrastructure?
Guidance: Describe vendor (Cisco Nexus/Catalyst, Arista, Juniper), topology (3-tier vs spine-leaf), age, and pain points

Question: How many racks and servers do you have in your data center?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 10-20 racks (small), 20-40 racks (medium), 40-100 racks (large), 100+ racks (hyperscale)
Notes: Determines switch count and fabric design

Question: What is your average server density per rack?
Guidance: Typical: 20-30 servers/rack (1U/2U servers), 40+ servers/rack (blade servers or high-density)

Question: What are your primary goals for data center network modernization?
Guidance: Common goals: Reduce costs vs Cisco, Support cloud-native workloads, Enable network automation, Improve east-west bandwidth, Simplify operations, Multi-tenant isolation

Question: How will you measure network modernization success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: Cost reduction %, Provisioning time, East-west throughput, Network uptime, Mean time to resolution

Question: What is your expected timeline for data center network deployment?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-6 months (new build), 6-12 months (refresh in place), 12-18 months (phased migration)

Question: What is your approved budget range for data center networking?
Guidance: Common ranges: $500K-$1M (20 racks), $1M-$2M (40 racks), $2M-$5M (100 racks). Include CapEx and OpEx

Question: What are your current annual network support and maintenance costs?
Guidance: Calculate: Cisco SmartNet at 15-20% of hardware list, annual support contracts

Question: How do you expect data center capacity to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Rack additions, server density increases, bandwidth growth

Question: What network topology do you prefer?
Guidance: Options: Spine-leaf (modern cloud-native), 3-tier (legacy core-agg-access), Leaf-spine with border leafs

Question: What oversubscription ratio is acceptable?
Guidance: Common: 3:1 (typical enterprise), 2:1 (higher performance), 1:1 (no oversubscription for HPC/storage)

Question: What network speed do servers require?
Guidance: Options: 1GbE (legacy), 10GbE (typical), 25GbE (modern), 40GbE (storage), 100GbE (high-performance)

Question: What core/spine uplink speed do you need?
Guidance: Options: 40GbE (small), 100GbE (typical), 200GbE (large), 400GbE (hyperscale)

Question: What percentage of traffic is east-west (server-to-server)?
Guidance: Modern cloud-native: 70-90% east-west. Traditional: 60-70%. Drives spine-leaf design

Question: What latency requirements apply to data center traffic?
Guidance: Common: <10 microseconds (typical), <2 microseconds (HPC/trading), <50 microseconds (acceptable for most apps)

Question: What jitter tolerance applies to real-time applications?
Guidance: Storage and VoIP: <1ms jitter. Video: <5ms. Affects QoS configuration

Question: How many VLANs or network segments do you need?
Guidance: Typical: 50-100 VLANs (multi-tenant), 500+ VLANs (cloud provider). VXLAN for large-scale
Notes: VLAN capacity and VXLAN overlay requirements

Question: Do you need VXLAN overlay for network virtualization?
Guidance: VXLAN: Multi-tenant isolation, L2 over L3, VM mobility. Required for cloud-native and SDN

Question: What routing protocols do you use or plan to use?
Guidance: Common: BGP (spine-leaf standard), OSPF (legacy), IS-IS (carrier-grade), Static routes

Question: Do you use BGP for data center fabric?
Guidance: BGP: Standard for spine-leaf (EVPN-VXLAN). eBGP between spine-leaf, iBGP within tier
Notes: BGP design and AS numbering scheme

Question: Do you have multicast requirements?
Guidance: Multicast: Financial trading, video distribution, replication. PIM-SM or VXLAN multicast

Question: Do you need IPv6 support for data center?
Guidance: IPv6: Dual-stack for future-proofing, native IPv6 for cloud-native apps

Question: Do you require jumbo frames (>1500 byte MTU)?
Guidance: Jumbo frames: 9000 byte MTU for storage, HPC, VM migration (vMotion). Requires end-to-end support

Question: Do you use LAG/MLAG for redundancy?
Guidance: LAG: Port channel for bandwidth aggregation. MLAG: Multi-chassis LAG for ToR redundancy

Question: What flow control mechanisms do you need?
Guidance: Options: Pause frames (legacy), Priority Flow Control (PFC for RoCE/iSCSI), Explicit Congestion Notification (ECN)

Question: Do you run iSCSI or NFS storage over Ethernet?
Guidance: Storage over Ethernet: iSCSI, NFS, SMB. May require dedicated VLAN or fabric

Question: Do you need RDMA over Converged Ethernet (RoCE)?
Guidance: RoCE: Low-latency storage and HPC. Requires lossless Ethernet (PFC) and QoS

Question: What network monitoring and visibility tools do you use?
Guidance: Common: sFlow, NetFlow, SNMP, Streaming Telemetry, Prometheus exporters. Integrate with monitoring platform

Question: Do you use network automation or infrastructure as code?
Guidance: Tools: Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Salt, Python (Netmiko/NAPALM). OS10 Linux-based supports automation

Question: What network segmentation and isolation requirements apply?
Guidance: Common: VLAN per application tier, Tenant isolation, DMZ, PCI cardholder environment

Question: Do you need ACLs for traffic filtering between segments?
Guidance: ACLs: Basic filtering at L3/L4. Consider NSX or firewall for stateful inspection

Question: Do you require MACsec encryption for data in transit?
Guidance: MACsec: Layer 2 encryption between switches. Required for compliance in some industries

Question: What DDoS protection mechanisms are required?
Guidance: DDoS: Rate limiting, ACLs, BGP Flowspec. Consider upstream scrubbing service

Question: What compliance standards must the network meet?
Guidance: Common: SOC 2, ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, FedRAMP

Question: What audit and logging requirements apply?
Guidance: SYSLOG to SIEM, AAA logging, configuration change tracking, SNMPv3

Question: What authentication and authorization is required for network management?
Guidance: Options: RADIUS, TACACS+, Local accounts. RBAC for role-based access

Question: What uptime SLA must the network achieve?
Guidance: Common targets: 99.9% (8.76 hours downtime/year), 99.99% (52 minutes/year), 99.999% (5 minutes/year)

Question: What redundancy architecture is required?
Guidance: Options: Active-passive, Active-active, N+1, 2N (full redundancy)

Question: How many spine switches for redundancy?
Guidance: Typical: 2 spines (minimum), 4 spines (higher bandwidth and redundancy). Each leaf dual-homed to spines

Question: Do you need redundant ToR switches per rack?
Guidance: Options: Single ToR (cost-optimized), Dual ToR with MLAG (high availability). Servers dual-homed for redundancy

Question: What power redundancy is required for network equipment?
Guidance: Options: Single PSU, Dual PSU (N+1), Dual-feed PDUs. Affects switch selection
Notes: Power redundancy and data center resilience

Question: What failover time is acceptable for routing convergence?
Guidance: BGP convergence: <1 second typical with BFD. Affects application timeout tolerance

Question: How do you handle switch maintenance and firmware upgrades?
Guidance: In-service software upgrade (ISSU), hitless upgrades, maintenance windows

Question: What network management platform do you use?
Guidance: Options: Dell SmartFabric Services, Ansible Tower, Cisco DNA Center, SolarWinds, PRTG, Custom automation

Question: Do you want zero-touch provisioning for switch deployment?
Guidance: ZTP: Automated switch onboarding via DHCP and template. Dell SmartFabric Services provides ZTP

Question: What configuration management approach do you prefer?
Guidance: Options: CLI (manual), Templates, Ansible playbooks, SmartFabric orchestration, Git-based (GitOps)

Question: What monitoring platform do you integrate with?
Guidance: Common: Prometheus/Grafana, Nagios, Zabbix, SolarWinds, PRTG, Splunk

Question: What Dell support coverage do you require?
Guidance: Options: ProSupport (next business day), ProSupport Plus (4-hour), Mission Critical (2-hour)

Question: Do you need spare switches for rapid replacement?
Guidance: Sparing: 10% spare pool typical (1 spare per 10 switches). Reduces RMA wait time

Question: What training does your network team need?
Guidance: Training: Dell OS10 administration, BGP configuration, VXLAN design, Ansible automation

Question: Do you need network design documentation and runbooks?
Guidance: Documentation: Physical/logical diagrams, IP addressing, VLAN assignment, troubleshooting runbooks

Question: What is your preferred deployment approach?
Guidance: Options: Greenfield (new data center), Brownfield refresh (in-place migration), Phased (rack-by-rack), Parallel (new fabric alongside old)

Question: How will you cut over from existing network to new fabric?
Guidance: Options: Big bang (weekend cutover), Phased by rack, vMotion VMs during migration, Parallel run

Question: What downtime windows are acceptable for network migration?
Guidance: Typical: Weekend maintenance, 4-8 hour window, Zero downtime (vMotion/live migration)

Question: What validation testing is required before production cutover?
Guidance: Tests: Throughput testing, Failover validation, Application connectivity, vMotion performance

Question: Do you want to pilot new network in one rack or POD first?
Guidance: Pilot: Validate design and performance before full deployment. Reduces risk

Question: Do you need Dell ProDeploy for design and implementation?
Guidance: ProDeploy: Architecture design, installation, configuration, knowledge transfer. Recommended for complex deployments

Question: What are your current annual network costs?
Guidance: Include: Cisco SmartNet (15-20% of list), switch refresh cycles, OpEx support

Question: What would Cisco Nexus refresh cost vs Dell PowerSwitch?
Guidance: Cisco Nexus 9K: ~2.5x higher than Dell PowerSwitch for equivalent ports and performance

Question: What ROI timeline are you targeting?
Guidance: Data center network refresh: 3-5 year lifecycle. TCO savings drive ROI

Question: Do you prefer CapEx purchase or OpEx leasing?
Guidance: Dell Financial Services: Leasing options to convert CapEx to OpEx
